@description.name: @description
@description.body:
A Button widget which supports various states and allows it to be used via the mouse, touch, pen and the keyboard. If the user presses the button by clicking on it, or the Enter or Space keys, the button fires an {@link qx.ui.core.MExecutable#execute} event. If the {@link qx.ui.core.MExecutable#command} property is set, the command is executed as well. Example Here is a little example of how to use the widget. 

   var button = new qx.ui.form.Button("Hello World");
   button.addListener("execute", function(e) {
     alert("Button was clicked");
   }, this);
   this.getRoot().add(button);

This example creates a button with the label "Hello World" and attaches an event listener to the {@link #execute} event. External Documentation Documentation of this widget in the qooxdoo manual.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: icon {String?null} Icon URL of the atom

@param.name: @param
@param.body: command {qx.ui.command.Command?null} Command instance to connect with

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A command called if the {@link #execute} method is called, e.g. on a button tap.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Manually press the button

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Manually release the button

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Completely reset the button (remove all states)

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Listener method for "pointerover" event

  • Adds state "hovered"
  • Removes "abandoned" and adds "pressed" state (if "abandoned" state is set)

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Listener method for "pointerout" event

  • Removes "hovered" state
  • Adds "abandoned" and removes "pressed" state (if "pressed" state is set)

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Listener method for "pointerdown" event

  • Removes "abandoned" state
  • Adds "pressed" state

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Listener method for "pointerup" event

  • Removes "pressed" state (if set)
  • Removes "abandoned" state (if set)
  • Adds "hovered" state (if "abandoned" state is not set)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Listener method for "tap" event which stops the propagation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Listener method for "keydown" event.
Removes "abandoned" and adds "pressed" state for the keys "Enter" or "Space"

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Listener method for "keyup" event.
Removes "abandoned" and "pressed" state (if "pressed" state is set) for the keys "Enter" or "Space"

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property command. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #command}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property command. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #command}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fire the "execute" event on the command.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler for the execute event of the command.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Event} The execute event of the command.
@param.description: The execute event of the command.

@description.name: @description

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #command}.
